intro: In this English for Developers Curriculum, you'll learn the essentials of English communication. This will follow the A2 level of the Common European Framework of Reference (CEFR). And we've focused on vocabulary that is particularly useful for developers.

The first half of the curriculum will help you get comfortable with English grammar and usage. It will give you tons of hands-on practice. You'll learn basics like introducing yourself, making small talk, and discussing your work.
In the second half, you'll practice vocabulary specific to software development. You'll learn how to describe code, discuss tech trends, and participate in stand-up meetings.
This entire A2-level curriculum includes 105 different dialogues. Each is designed to build your vocabulary and boost your confidence when speaking in a professional tech setting.

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to start a conversation in casual settings. You'll also learn how to talk about your hobbies and personality traits. You'll even learn how to ask about places around the town.

challenges.name: Learn Conversation Starters in the Break Room

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 3: Tom Asks About the Team Lead
Dialogue 4: Talking About the Monday Meetings
Dialogue 5: Knowing the Area Around the Company

desc: In this first course, you'll learn common expressions for situations you may encounter on your first day at work. You'll learn about introductions, getting to know people, asking for lunch recommendations, and getting an access card from security.

challenges.name: Learn Greetings in your First Day at the Office

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Maria Introduces Herself to Tom
Dialogue 2: Tom Meets the Coworker Next to Him
Dialogue 3: Tom and Sophie Take a Lunch Break
Dialogue 4: Sophie Introduces Brian to Tom
Dialogue 5: End of the First Day

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to ask about another person's educational and professional backgrounds and you'll learn how to share information about your background as well.

challenges.name: Learn How to Ask and Share About Educational and Professional Background

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 3: Two Workmates Talk About Their Backgrounds
Dialogue 4: A Developer with a Different Background
Dialogue 5: Anna Talks About her Experience

desc: In this course, you will see how you can ask questions to clarify things which are not very clear to you in a code.

challenges.name: Learn How to Ask for Clarification on Code Understanding

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Asking for Help to Understand Code
Dialogue 2: Asking for Help on a Bug

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to check to see if the information you had is correct and how to ask for clarification when something is not clear to you.

challenges.name: Learn How to Clarify Information in Different Interactions

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 5: Arrangements for a Company Party

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to talk about the projects that you are involved in and how to inform others of what you are doing in these projects. It mainly focuses on the structures used for informing it and on the related vocabulary.

challenges.name: Learn How to Describe Your Current Project

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Sophie and James Discuss Their Projects
Dialogue 2: Data Analysis Team Discuss Their Projects
Dialogue 3: Maria and Mark Talk about Their Project
Dialogue 4: Brian Talks To Amy About Their Projects
Dialogue 5: Bob and Sarah Talk About Their Projects

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to discuss about things that everybody's talking about in technology these days.

challenges.name: Learn How to Discuss Popular Trends in Technology

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 2: Talking about Remote Work and Collaboration Tools

desc: In this course, you'll discuss people's roles and responsibilities in a company and out of it. You'll discover how to ask about these roles and responsibilities and how to share information about you related to the topic.

challenges.name: Learn How to Discuss Roles and Responsibilities

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Describing Other People and What They Do
Dialogue 4: Sophie Asks Bob about His Responsibilities
Dialogue 5: Brian And Sophie Talk about Responsibilities

desc: In this course, you will be introduced to some recent trends in the world of technology and learn how to discuss them in English.

challenges.name: Learn How to Discuss Tech Trends and Updates

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to talk about details of your routine and share them with someone else. It mainly focuses on the structures used for declaring routine actions and related vocabulary.

challenges.name: Learn How to Discuss Your Morning or Evening Routine

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Learn How to Discuss your Morning or Evening Routine
Dialogue 4: Brian and Maria Talk about Eventful Evenings
Dialogue 5: Sophie and Brian Talk about the Weekend

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to ask about what motivates people in their personal and professional lives, answer questions related to your motivations, and discuss about people's preferences.

challenges.name: Learn How to Have a Conversation About Preferences and Motivations

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 3: Talking about Motivations to Pursue a Career

desc: In this course, you will learn expression related to how to ask for help from a coworker as well as how to offer them some assistance.

challenges.name: Learn How to Help a Coworker Troubleshoot on GitHub

desc: This course will show you how to talk about your projects in terms of what you have already done and what you are currently doing in them.

challenges.name: Learn How to Share Your Progress in Weekly Stand-up Meetings

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Offering Suggestions in a Meeting
Dialogue 2: Asking and Offering Help on a Meeting

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to talk about your workday and the tasks that you perform in the workplace and how to share them with others. It mainly focuses on the structures used for describing your activities and task-related vocabulary.

challenges.name: Learn How to Talk About a Typical Workday and Tasks

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: Tom Asks Sophie About Her Routine
Dialogue 2: Anna from HR Tells Tom About the Company Routine
Dialogue 3: Jake Tells Sophie About His Routine
Dialogue 5: Brian Asks Sarah About Her Routine as a QA Tester

desc: In this course, you'll learn different ways to talk about hobbies and things that interest you. You'll also learn how to ask about other people's hobbies and how to invite them to join you in these activities.

challenges.name: Learn How to Talk About Hobbies and Interests

desc: This course will present basic vocabulary related to programming. You'll learn how to ask questions related to basic programming concepts.

challenges.name: Learn How to Use Basic Programming Vocabulary in Conversations

desc: In this course, you will be introduced to terms related to coding and learn how to use them in conversation.

challenges.name: Learn How to Use Code-related Concepts and Terms

desc: In this course, you'll learn how to give a personal introduction. You'll also learn how to state your profession, and share your goals in group meetings.

challenges.name: Learn Introductions in an Online Team Meeting

challengeOrder.title: Dialogue 1: A Mobile Developer Joins the Team
Dialogue 2: Introducing the New Junior Developer
